column4: I don't understand what you mean by "it wants to run the liveCD"? What are the symptoms of the problem you are having?
ok you know when you put a iso disc in to install Xubuntu?
and a menu will come up and the first option will be to try xubuntu without installing
the second option will be to install
When you boot from the CD? Then yes, I know what you are taling about.

well if you pick the first option it will do what I am talking about and just run the op system without installing it, if you hit install then it will install the op system, which is what I am wanting to do but itstead its just running it.
There is very little difference between the two options from a technical perspective, and in 10.04 you are by default given the choice after X (the GUI) has started.
yes I know what you are talking about. Being able to install once your desktop comes up. When I try to do it that way since it won't work the other way it crashes on me.
You can get the screen as you would see it in previous versions by pressing a key during early boot, but there isn't much of a reason to do that.
Then it will almost certainly crash with the install option also.
I don't understand why its crashing. I mean well its not really crashing its generating errors and semi crashing.
But if you want to try it then just press any key during early boot (when you see just the accessability icon at the bottom of the screen)
I think it has something to do with the fact its such an old computer
If you have integrated graphics then you just barely don't have enough ram for the liveCD installer. Try the alternate (text based) install CD
ubottu: I can't use this cd to switch to that one you are talking about some how?
oh man figures....Alright well thanks for your help]
